Key Match Events: Brazil dominated possession but lacked precision in front of goal with just three of their 19 shots on target.
A free kick flicked on by Rodrygo was disallowed for offside after a lengthy VAR delay.
Lucas Paquetá rattled the woodwork with a long-range effort in the 63rd minute.
Guilherme Arana's strike was kept out by a fine save from Costa Rica's Patrick Sequeira.
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil, who came into the Copa América on the back of a run of poor results in recent months, dominated possession but lacked precision in front of goal.
Costa Rica looked to contain their opponents and deprive them of space.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil defender Marquinhos said, 'Now it's about being honest with ourselves, creating alternatives to create chances, scoring, results are important in this competition.'
Costa Rica coach Gustavo Alfaro said, 'We were Bruce Willis in 'The Sixth Sense,' where the only one that did not know he was dead was him, right?'
Brazil's Lucas Paquetá said, 'We played our game, we have to improve our finishing, myself in particular and other players, so that we can win.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Neymar, Brazil's all-time leading scorer, cut a dejected figure as he looked on from the stands.
